definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Homophones are the universal and very important phenomena in languages.
sentences.chinese: 同音詞是語言中極其重要而又十分普遍的現象。

sentences.english: Homonym problem was put forward in the course of Chinese reform of a writing system.
sentences.chinese: 同音詞問題是在中國文字改革的過程中提出來的。

sentences.english: This is true even in homonyms.
sentences.chinese: 即使是同音詞也是如此。

sentences.english: Secondly, we have analysed the reason why the homonym produces .
sentences.chinese: 其次，分析了同音詞產生的原因。

sentences.english: Homonymity is an interesting linguistic phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 同音詞是一個有趣的語言現象。

sentences.english: You chose the words with the same sounds but different meanings.
sentences.chinese: 你可以瞭解中文同音詞。

sentences.english: Confusion of homonym is a long-term disturbing problem in current Chinese Braille.
sentences.chinese: 同音詞混淆是長期困擾現行盲文的問題。
